mcn.cloud_integrations.description: Set up credentialed access to our virtual cloud network partners.

mcn.edit_provider.description: Edit your integration. Hereu2019s some extra context if necessary.

mcn.providers.manage_and_monitor: Manage and monitor the status of your existing cloud integrations. Integrations in use may not be deleted.
mcn.resource_catalog.heading: Cloud Resources
mcn.resource_catalog.description: This shows resources from all your cloud integrations. You can filter by integration.
mcn.provider_wizard.title: New Cloud Integration
mcn.provider_wizard.description: Set up credentialed access to our virtual cloud network partners
mcn.emptylist_page.title: Connect your virtual cloud networks to Cloudflare
mcn.emptylist_page.description: Integrate your third-party cloud networks and resources.
mcn.emptylist_page.section1.title: Integrate your cloud network
mcn.emptylist_page.section1.text1: Cloudflare currently supports integrations with AWS, Azure, and GCP.
mcn.emptylist_page.section1.text2: Authorize your credentials so Cloudflare can discover and manage resources.

mcn.emptylist_page.section2.text1: Assign where Cloudflare installs new routes.
mcn.emptylist_page.section2.text2: Review and deploy your new on-ramp.
mcn.listpage.banner.content: You have %{count} integration(s) that need to be reviewed.
mcn.link_account_details_description: Credentials must be active to maintain monitoring and updating capabilities.
mcn.authorization.link_to_dif_cloud: Link integration to a different cloud account
mcn.authorize_provider.loading_descripti: Please wait while we fetch the details for the selected cloud provider. This may take a few moments.
mcn.authorize_provider.unsupported_descr: The selected cloud provider is currently not supported. Please check the documentation or contact support for more information.
mcn.authorize_provider.aws_title: Authorize access to your AWS account
mcn.authorize_provider.aws_description: Create a role in your AWS account to grant Cloudflare permissions.
mcn.authorization.aws.authorize_label: I authorize Cloudflare to access my AWS account.
mcn.authorization.create_aws_role_descri: Create a role for Cloudflare to use when accessing your account. Use the following settings:
mcn.authorization.provide_aws_role_descr: Enter the ARN for the role you created in step two. Cloudflare will assume this role when taking actions in your AWS account.
mcn.authorization.create_iam_policy_desc: Select the IAM policy instructions below. The instructions will guide you in creating an AWS IAM policy that allows Cloudflare to manage or monitor your AWS networks.
mcn.authorization.aws_trusted_entity: Trusted entity: Attach the custom trust policy displayed below.
mcn.authorization.aws_permissions: Permissions: Attach the IAM policies listed in step one.
mcn.authorization.authorize_required: You must authorize Cloudflare to access your AWS account.
mcn.google.authorize_provider.title: Create GCP service account
mcn.google.authorize_provider.page.title: Authorize your GCP integration
mcn.google.authorize_provider.descriptio: You must create a service account and give permissions to Cloudflareu2019s bot account.
mcn.google.authorize_provider.create_des: Create a service account in your GCP Console using the instructions linked below.
mcn.google.authorization.authorize_label: I authorize Cloudflare to access my GCP account.
mcn.authorization.create_service_account: Follow the steps in the provided documentation to create a service account in your Google Cloud Platform project.
mcn.google.authorization.assign_roles_pe: Grant Cloudflareu2019s GCP account permission to access the new service account.
mcn.google.authorization.provide_service: Provide service account email and project ID
Enter the email address and project ID for the service account you created in step one. Cloudflare will use this service account and project ID when taking actions in your GCP account.
mcn.authorization.error_loading_policy: Failed to load the policy, please try again later.
mcn.authorization.error: Failed to load, please try again later.
mcn.google.authorization.verify_account_: Add the following label to your GCP project:
mcn.google.authorization.how_to_add_tag: How to add a tag using the portal
mcn.google.authorization.add_cli_command: Optionally use the following command to add the tag:
mcn.authorization.gcp_service_account_re: GCP service account email is required.
mcn.google.authorization.gcp_instruction: Grant Cloudflareu2019s GCP account permission to access your new service account. Follow the step-by-step instructions in this link:
mcn.authorize_provider.azure_description: You will be redirected to the Azure portal to create a service principal for Cloudflare to use to access your account.
mcn.azure.authorization.select_open_azur: Select the button below to open a new tab to log in with your Azure account.
mcn.azure.authorization.select_instructi: Select the below instructions. The instructions will guide you in assigning Cloudflare the permissions it needs to manage or monitor your Azure networks.
mcn.azure.authorization.identify_subscri: Identify which account (subscription and tenant) Cloudflare will access using the new service principal.
mcn.azure.authorization.add_tag.descript: Add the following tag to your Azure subscription:
mcn.azure.authorization.authorize_checkb: I authorize Cloudflare to access my Azure account.
mcn.provider_save.manage_integrations_ti: Authorize Cloudflare to access your %{cloud_type} account
mcn.provider_save.aws_integration_body: Create a role in your AWS account for Cloudflare. You will need the correct AWS permissions to make IAM changes.
mcn.provider_save.azure_integration_body: Create a service principal in your tenant for Cloudflare. You will need permissions to make extra ID changes in your Azure account.
mcn.provider_save.gcp_integration_body: Create a service account in your GCP account for Cloudflare. You will need permissions to make IAM changes in your GCP account.
